column5:
Latest News:

International Restrictions:
*All travellers: From 1 December 2022, Seychelles will no longer require COVID-19 vaccination or a negative COVID-19 test from visitors. However, they will need to complete the Travel Declaration and have a valid Travel and Health Insurance to cover for potential COVID-19 related costs.
Proof of vaccination status: Proof of vaccination is no longer required.
*If you’re transiting through Seychelles: Transiting is when you pass through one country on the way to your final destination.
International passengers wishing to transit through Seychelles to their destination are required to follow the guidelines on the ‘conditions for entry’ at the Ministry of Health website.
*Exemptions: There are no exemptions to the entry requirements for Seychelles.


Internal Restrictions:
*Travel in Seychelles: Seychelles borders are open. From 1 December 2022, entry in Seychelles has resumed to pre-covid protocols. Travellers are no longer required to be vaccinated, or present a negative COVID-19 test to enter Seychelles. You should follow the advice of the local authorities. See the Seychelles Islands Another World website for further details.
*Accommodation: Visitors are encouraged to stay at a licensed tourism accommodation. *Public spaces and services: The Government of Seychelles has lifted most of its COVID-19 restrictions. It is now optional to wear a face mask when outdoors. However, wearing face masks remains mandatory on buses and other public transport such as taxis, boats and planes.
Restrictions are enforceable by law and can change at short notice. You should consult the Ministry of Health in Seychelles for further information and monitor local media for the latest developments.
